cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles east-southeast of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest, expected to skirt the Yucatán Peninsula this weekend then accelerate north-northwest across the central Gulf toward the Louisiana coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coastline near or just west of Plaquemines Parish

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Punta Herrero to Cancún, Mexico
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning Honduras/Nicaragua border to Punta Castilla, Bay Islands of Honduras, Puerto Cabezas northward, Punta Herrero to Cancún
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf Coast from Texas–Louisiana border eastward to Alabama is within the 5-day cone
weather_observation.wind: Low but increasing chance (≈10%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds by late Monday night/early Tuesday; strongest gusts could reach 40–45 mph if the track shifts closer.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Early guidance suggests minor to moderate surge of 2–4 ft above ground level possible along lower Plaquemines Parish if the center makes landfall nearby.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands could bring 4–6 inches of rainfall with locally higher totals, leading to flash-flood potential in low-lying port facilities.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough Gulf seas and long-period swells beginning late Sunday will disrupt cargo operations and small-craft movement well in advance of landfall.
